title: I get speeds around 10 Mb but every so often I get buffering for seconds and speed drops to around 1 Mb and a few Kb upload.
content:
I get speeds around 10 Mb but every so often I get buffering for seconds and speed drops to around 1 Mb and a few Kb upload. Panning my cctv cameras can vary from a delay of 0.5 scs to several seconds. Three years ago my estate was told that high speed fibre would be available but we are still waiting (we are only 100mtrs from the Plympton exchange.) There is no response whatsoever from OpenReach and it says no update is planned now.

How can I find out what is happening.? if I am not going to get fibre then I will cancel my contract and switch to 5G.
creator: julian48

title: Suddenly unable to login to eBay using Firefox...
content:
I am suddenly unable to login in to eBay using Firefox. This just started this morning (it was working fine last night). I opened Firefox in safe mode - no change - so it is not a plugin that is causing the problem. Here is what happens:

I click on my bookmark, and the login screen for eBay opens (sometimes). I enter the username, then it takes me to the stupid Captcha page. I pass that, then it goes back to the username page and says, "Oops, that's not a match". It will do this repeatedly for hours on end if I chose to do so. I have cleared the cache/cookies, so that is not he issue, either.

I can login to eBay just fine with Safari and Edge, so it is not a problem with my operating system. If anyone knows what might be causing this, your input will be greatly appreciated. Firefox version is 132.0.2.
creator: WakkoWarner

title: "This Connection is Untrusted" displayed for all website queries
content:
Attempting to upgrade and recommission an old HP laptop not used in several years. Currently running Firefox Version 41.0.1

Any queries to legitimate websites such as Google or Mozilla, return a "This Connection is Untrusted" display screen. Firefox security settings have been changed to lowest security, and problem persists.

It isn't that Firefox isn't reaching the websites... it's that some security setting recognizing the security certificates (like Mozilla's) is broken... and I can't get past it... even to be able to download a new browser version.

title: Website Not Loading Properly on Firefox
content:
Hi Firefox Community,

I am encountering an issue with my website, https://dogumgunumesaji.org/, when using the Firefox browser. The site functions perfectly on other browsers such as Chrome, Edge, and Safari. However, on Firefox, it either loads inconsistently or fails to load entirely.

To address this problem, I cleared the browser’s cache and cookies, disabled all extensions, and even tested the site on multiple devices running Firefox. Despite these efforts, the issue persists, indicating that it may be specific to Firefox rather than a device-related problem.

I am reaching out to the community for suggestions or troubleshooting steps that could resolve this issue. Are there any known Firefox settings or compatibility concerns that might be causing this behavior? Could a recent update to the browser be contributing to this problem?

Any assistance or insights into resolving this would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your time and support!
creator: baliankeen

title: How to create a shortcut/tile to add to Home page
content: There used to be a way to add a web site as a shortcut to the Home page by dragging the link and dropping it somewhere. Those instructions seem to have disappeared. One of the sites I had pinned to the Home page has changed. I can remove the old link (tile), but how do I add the new link as a tile? The help articles no longer provide any information about how to do this. Just "pinning' the page adds it to the toolbar, where I don't want it, but does not add it to the Home page. Do I have to just close and open that site a bunch of times in order to get it to appear???? There should be a more sensible way.

title: How to select the instance to open links in
content: I have two instances of two different profiles (lets call them profile A and profile B) of Firefox running simultaneously. When I click on a link in another application (for example a link in Thunderbird) the Firefox instance I started last will open up the link. This can be profile A or profile B, whichever I started later. However, I would like links to be open in the instance of profile A at all times. How can I do this without making sure profile A is started after profile B? Previously I could achieve this using the -no-remote command line option. This option has been removed from the latest Firefox version.

title: Immagini in Firefox per MacOs
content:
Buongiorno,

non so per quale motivo Firefox a volte storpia le immagini, quasi come come se tentasse a fare dei refresh della stessa, e questi refresh non siano sincronizzati col resto della pagina web. L'immagine si sposta o si deforma, con dei tagli netti obliqui. A volte sembra che faccia il refresh a seconda di come si sposti il puntatore del mouse. La cosa succede solo con Firefox, non con Safari, Duckduckgo o altri browser. Ho provato sia reinstallare Firefox ultima versione ma nessun miglioramento. La cosa succede sia con MacOs Sonoma o Sequoia, anche su iMac diversi. Se provo a fare uno screenshot della pagina con firefox, l'immagine salvata è normale. Quindi il problema è solo alla visualizzazione e solo con firefox. Qualcun'altro ha sto problema e come ha risolto? Grazie.

title: Suggestions for Improving Firefox Browser Features
content:
Dear Mozilla Firefox Team,

My name is Bohdan, and I am an active user of your browser. I greatly appreciate the efforts of your team in developing such a convenient and secure product. I would like to express my gratitude for the excellent work on Firefox and would like to propose a few ideas that I believe could enhance the user experience.

Selective Tab Removal Feature Often, when working with a large number of tabs, there's a need to close only some of them. It would be very useful if there were a feature that allows users to select multiple tabs and close them simultaneously. This would significantly simplify the organization of work with tabs and allow users to manage open pages more effectively.

Adding Ukrainian Language to the Page Translation Tool For Ukrainian users, it is important to have the ability to translate web pages into Ukrainian directly in the browser. Given the significant number of Ukrainian-speaking users, this would be a very important and helpful addition. I hope that such an option will be implemented in future updates.

I would be very grateful if you could consider these suggestions for inclusion in future updates. I believe these changes would be useful for many users and would enhance their experience with Firefox.

Sincerely, Bohdan
creator: bogdanserg48

title: "Reopen last closed tab or window" function (Ctrl+Shift+T) does not seem to be remembering closed tabs any more.
content:
Normally, if I were to close a tab while using a regular Firefox window, I could use the Ctrl+Shift+T hotkey to bring that tab back again. However, if I do so right now (for example, Wikipedia's Mozilla article), I will not bring that page back but instead an older, longer-closed tab from some days ago. I can keep trying to close and reopen tabs, or just keep reopening tabs, and I will continue to dig up older and older tabs from longer and longer ago.

Is this a known issue, what might have changed that behavior, and how do I restore the expected functionality of tabs correctly being reopened in the reverse order that they were closed?
